intro: Porphyroscias decursiva, commonly known as the red spider lily, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its striking red, spider-like flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has strap-like, dark green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade. Porphyroscias decursiva is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
